intro: Pentacalia befarioides, commonly known as the Cape mountain kempa, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It features succulent leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and protected in its natural habitat.
